senses.de: Something that is delicate is easy to break or damage
senses.ex: Be careful with that vase, it's very delicate.

Tips.title: Handle With Care
Tips.description: Use 'delicate' to describe items that need gentle treatment to avoid breaking them.
Tips.example: This china set is a family heirloom and very delicate; please wash it by hand.

Tips.title: Visual Delicacy
Tips.description: 'Delicate' can imply something has a fine, almost ethereal quality to its appearance.
Tips.example: The delicate craftsmanship of the jewelry was breathtaking.

senses.de: A delicate taste or smell is light and pleasant
senses.ex: The wine has a delicate aroma.

Tips.title: Subtle Sensations
Tips.description: Use 'delicate' when describing flavors or smells that are pleasantly understated.
Tips.example: The soup had a delicate hint of thyme.

Tips.title: Pleasantly Light
Tips.description: 'Delicate' often conveys a sense of sophistication in taste or smell.
Tips.example: She preferred the delicate scent of jasmine in her perfume.

senses.de: If a situation is delicate, it is difficult and needs to be handled carefully
senses.ex: The political situation in the region is very delicate.

Tips.title: Careful Approach
Tips.description: 'Delicate' signifies that a situation requires diplomatic handling.
Tips.example: Negotiating the contract will be a delicate process.

Tips.title: Sensitive Topic
Tips.description: Use 'delicate' to indicate that a subject is potentially contentious or emotionally charged.
Tips.example: Discussions about inheritance matters can be quite delicate.

senses.de: Someone who is delicate is not healthy and becomes sick easily
senses.ex: She was a delicate child and was often ill.

Tips.title: Health Implications
Tips.description: Describe a person with a weak constitution or frequent illnesses as 'delicate'.
Tips.example: After the surgery, she had a delicate recovery period.

Tips.title: Physical Tenderness
Tips.description: 'Delicate' can refer to someone's tender appearance suggesting vulnerability.
Tips.example: He had a delicate frame that made him appear younger than he was.

senses.de: Something that is delicate is small, thin, and light

Tips.title: Fine Details
Tips.description: 'Delicate' can be applied to objects with intricate detail that are admired for their beauty.
Tips.example: The artist's use of delicate lines added elegance to the drawing.

Tips.title: Graceful Quality
Tips.description: Use 'delicate' to suggest gracefulness or daintiness in physical features or movements.
Tips.example: Her delicate dance movements captivated the audience.

Dainty.wordDefinition:
Dainty and delicate are both words that describe something that is small and fragile.

However, dainty usually refers to objects that are pleasing to the eye and charmingly small, such as dainty jewelry or a dainty dessert.

Both words can describe small and fragile things, but dainty emphasizes the attractiveness of the object, while delicate emphasizes the fragility of the object.

Faint.wordDefinition:
Faint refers to something that is very weak or hard to detect.

Delicate refers to something that is fragile or requires care, while faint refers to something that is weak or hard to detect.

Fine.wordDefinition:
Fine usually refers to something that is of high quality or has a good level of detail. For example, fine art or fine wine.

Both words can describe something that is refined or sensitive, but the main difference is that delicate refers to fragility while fine refers to excellence.

Fragile.wordDefinition:
It can describe objects, fabrics, or situations that need to be treated with care and attention. Fragile refers to something that is easily broken or damaged, often used to describe objects that are made of glass, porcelain, or other materials that can shatter easily.

Fragile can also describe emotions or relationships that are easily damaged or sensitive. Both words relate to things that are easily damaged, but delicate is often used to describe something that requires skill or precision to handle gently, while fragile describes something that is easily broken or damaged.

Gentle.wordDefinition:
Gentle on the other hand means soft, kind, or mild. It is applicable when talking about treating people or things in a kind way.

For example, a gentle touch, a gentle voice, or a gentle breeze.

To summarize, delicate is used for fragile objects or sensitive situations, while gentle is used for kind treatment of people or objects.

Sensitive.wordDefinition:
Delicate implies that something is easily damaged or broken, while the word sensitive means that something or someone is easily affected by outside factors.

A sensitive person may be easily affected by criticism or changes in the environment.

Delicate is used more for physical objects, while sensitive is used more for emotional or physiological responses.

Sophisticated.wordDefinition:
Sophisticated describes something that is refined or cultured. It is applicable when talking about things that have been developed to a high level of complexity or have a great deal of knowledge or expertise behind them, such as a sophisticated piece of technology or a sophisticated fashion sense.

Delicate refers to something that needs to be handled carefully because it is fragile or sensitive, while sophisticated refers to something that has been developed to a high level of complexity or has a great deal of knowledge or expertise behind it.

Subtle.wordDefinition:
Subtle refers to something that is not obvious or easily noticeable, but rather requires a closer observation or analysis to be understood or appreciated.

For example, subtle changes in facial expressions can reveal someone's true feelings, or a subtle flavor in a dish can enhance its overall taste.

Delicate describes things that are physically fragile or require sensitive handling, while subtle describes things that are more abstract or nuanced and require a closer attention to detail.

Tender.wordDefinition:
It can also refer to things that are subtle or refined, like delicate flavors or delicate instruments. Tender on the other hand, means something that is soft and gentle, often used to describe something that is easy to chew or cut, like tender meat.

Both words can be applicable in many different situations, depending on what you are describing. For example, delicate jewelry would be something that needs to be handled gently and stored carefully, while tender feelings might be used to describe someone who is easily hurt emotionally.

quotes.Text: Startups can be the most conservative organizations in the world. We spend so much energy nurturing our delicate egos against naysayers and self-doubt that we can hardly admit mistakes. This is especially true of first-time CEOs.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Glenn Kelman

quotes.Text: A woman is gentle, soft, delicate, and a man's position is to protect her, help her up stairs, make sure she's in the car safely first. Take good care of your woman, and the sky's the limit!
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Taraji P. Henson

quotes.Text: The questions worth asking, in other words, come not from other people but from nature, and are for the most part delicate things easily drowned out by the noise of everyday life.
quotes.Title: American Physicist
quotes.Name: Robert B. Laughlin

quotes.Text: Love is something that is genuine, delicate and involves care, passion and attention, and is entirely different to gifts, balls, jewels and circumstance.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Rege-Jean Page

quotes.Text: One of the core organizing principles of my life is that success comes through a delicate balance between making things happen and letting things happen.
quotes.Title: Canadian Lawyer
quotes.Name: Robin S. Sharma

quotes.Text: Hearts that are delicate and kind and tongues that are neither - these make the finest company in the world.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Logan Pearsall Smith

quotes.Text: I'm quite obsessed with the idea of nailing the girl friendship. It's such an art, so delicate.
quotes.Title: Canadian Musician
quotes.Name: Alanis Morissette

quotes.Text: When you see how fragile and delicate life can be, all else fades into the background.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Jenna Morasca

quotes.Text: I was so overprotected, I used to think I was as delicate as people said I was.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Natalie Wood

quotes.Text: Absences are a good influence in love and keep it bright and delicate.
quotes.Title: Scottish Writer
quotes.Name: Robert Louis Stevenson
